artists.name: R.D. Burman
artists.description: Iconic film composer, fused Western rock/jazz with Bollywood soundtracks.

artists.name: M.S. Viswanathan
artists.description: Prolific South Indian film composer, blended Carnatic traditions with popular melodies.

artists.name: Ahmed Rushdi
artists.description: Pop pioneer of Pakistan, known for youthful and modern playback singing.

artists.name: Noor Jehan
artists.description: Film queen and legendary playback singer of Pakistan.

artists.name: Sabri Brothers
artists.description: Qawwali masters, brought devotional Sufi music to international audiences.

artists.name: Clarence Wijewardena
artists.description: Pop and Baila innovator, often called the father of Sri Lankan pop music.

artists.name: The Spiders
artists.description: Key 'Group Sounds' band, part of Japan’s 1960s rock boom.

artists.name: The Tigers
artists.description: Another leading 'Group Sounds' band, teen idols blending Beatles-style rock with Japanese pop.

artists.name: Toru Takemitsu
artists.description: Avant-garde composer blending Western orchestral music with Japanese timbres and aesthetics.

artists.name: Koes Plus
artists.description: Rock band considered the 'Beatles of Indonesia,' pioneers of Indonesian pop and rock.

artists.name: The Steps
artists.description: One of the early Indonesian beat/rock groups of the 1960s.

artists.name: The Dawn
artists.description: Late 60s garage roots; pioneers of the Manila sound.

artists.name: Teresa Teng
artists.description: Rising towards the end of the 60s; later became one of Asia’s most beloved singers.

artists.name: Model Opera Troupes
artists.description: Revolutionary ensembles performing state-approved works during the Cultural Revolution.
